dsDescriptionValue.value: This is a spreadsheet with information on immigrant politicians in Switzerland. I have collect in a haphazard way information on politicians in Switzerland who are immigrants, or descendants of immigrants. There is no system in the collection of these data, I simply jotted down when I came across relevant information. I have not triangulated the data, and the data are definitely incomplete (especially the "timeline" bit). Expect some mistakes.

fields.value:
**Level**: national, cantonal (=regional), local (=municipal).
Chamber: actual chamber (NR=National Council, SR=Council of States, BR=Federal Council)
**Elected**: was the person elected or just a candidate. See timeline for more details.
**First and family name** of the politician.
**Gender**: male, female.
**Canton**: canton of Switzerland (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_codes_for_Switzerland#Cantons for coding)
**Party affiliation**, using common (German language) abbreviations.
**Immigration background**: brief description why the person can be counted as "immigrant" or a descendant of an immigrant. Where only the wife or husband is mentioned, the politician is not an immigrant, but for some applications knowing that the politicians is married to an "immigrant" can be useful.
**Country of birth**, **citizenship** at birth: where known, some German in there.
**Generation**: using the common shorthand, whereby 1 means the person is an "immigrant", 2 means that one of their parents was an "immigrant", 3 means that one of their grandparents was an "immigrant", and so on.
**Other**: further details where applicable, mostly copied from sources
**Source**, source detail: where I have the information from, not always recorded.
**1971**, 1972, ... 2017, 2018: This is the "timeline", where I tried to note down when the politicians were active, and at what level. This part is particularly experimental, will have gaps and mistakes. The entries are as follows: "NC" for candidate for office at the national level, "NE" for elected into national office, "CC" for candidate for office at the cantonal level, "CE" for elected into cantonal office, "LC" for candidate for office at the local level, and "LE" for elected into local office. "X" indicates a year when the politicians was mentioned (thus likely to be active). I also used "X" for the non-immigrant politicians married to politicians.
I used both citizenship and country of birth as a criterion to identify "immigrants".
